intro: Medinilla sapoi-riverensis, commonly known as the riverine medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that resemble a cluster of small, fleshy flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found near rivers or streams, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, with a waxy texture that helps it retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
